sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

came to lunch, & were shown over the Castle. The lad seems very intelligent. After they had taken their leave, I walked round the Park with
Ella & Fearne with two young officers from Catterick went off to dine with old M
Kirk in Norton, & go to a dance, which his daughter is promoting nominally in aid of the local hospital. Lionel & I dined together.

The whole day has been wasted because I cannot make up my mind whether to write, or what to write about this miserable "crisis". Something, perhaps, I owe to my friends, in whose eyes, naturally but nonetheless unjustly, I seem to have abandoned the Protestant Cause, of which they were fools enough to imagine I was a champion.
